8/6/2018.name: Orientation for Seniors
8/6/2018.description:
For seniors who are returning SHS students
Seniors may choose to attend an orientation session on Monday, Aug. 6 any time between 8-11 a.m. or noon-3 p.m.

Orientation begins in the Patriot Lobby (Room 2104) with students acknowledging and signing that they have received an electronic copy of the Guidebook. Seniors must have their paid registration receipt and school-issued iPad to receive their student ID. 

Those students who had their ID photo taken last spring should report to Room 2104 to pick up their pre-printed ID. Those who did not take their picture in the Spring will have their picture taken in 2104. Once the student has either received their ID or taken their picture, they will be directed to the Forum to pick up their ID’s (if theirs wasn’t pre-printed), and to pick up their schedules in the upper Forum. After students have obtained their schedules, they will either proceed to the Lower Sport Center to pick up their textbooks. Students will not be able to pick up schedule/textbooks until they have signed electronically, obtained their ID and have their hand stamped by a Dean.

No bus service will be available during orientation for seniors.

For seniors who are transfer students
 Transfer students will attend Transfer Student Orientation from 9-11 a.m. on Thursday, Aug. 9 in the Little Theater (Room 4200). Members of the Student Volunteer Program will be at this orientation to assist new students in finding classrooms, answering questions, etc. SHS volunteers will assist transfer students throughout the first week of school — introducing new students, meeting for lunch, etc.

8/6/2018.name: Fall Play Auditions
8/6/2018.description: Auditions for the fall theatrical production, Distracted, will be held at 4 p.m. Monday, Aug. 6 in the Black Box Theatre (Room 2204) by the Sports Center entrance. Students can sign up for an audition slot and download the audition packet on the auditions and rehearsals page.

8/6/2018.name: Shrek Audition Sign-Up Starts
8/6/2018.description:
Students interested in auditioning for the 2018-19 musical, Shrek the Musical, can sign up for an audition slot beginning Monday, Aug. 6.

Sign up for an audition slot and download the audition packet from the auditions and rehearsals page.

Here is the audition schedule:

Thursday, Aug. 16 - Audition workshop
 Monday, Aug. 20 - Vocal auditions
Tuesday, Aug. 21 - Dance auditions
Wednesday and Thursday, Aug. 22-23 - Callbacks

8/7/2018.name: Orientation for Juniors
8/7/2018.description:
For juniors who are returning SHS students

Juniors may choose to attend an orientation session any time between 8-11 a.m. or noon-3 p.m on Tuesday, Aug. 7. 

Orientation begins in the Patriot Lobby with students acknowledging and signing that they have received an electronic copy of the Guidebook. Students must have their paid registration receipt and school-issued iPad to receive their Student ID. 

Those students who had their ID photo taken last spring should report to Room 2104 to pick up their pre-printed ID. Those who did not take their picture in the Spring will have their picture taken in 2104. Once students have either received their ID or taken their picture, they will be directed to the Forum to pick up their ID’s (if theirs wasn’t pre-printed), and to pick up their schedules in the upper Forum.

After juniors have obtained their schedules, they will either proceed to get yearbook photos in the Testing Center (Room 1200/1202) or to the Lower Sport Center to pick up their textbooks. Students will not be able to pick up schedule/textbooks until they have signed electronically, obtained their ID and have their hand stamped by a dean.

No bus service will be available during orientation for juniors.

For juniors who are transfer students

Transfer students will attend Transfer Student Orientation from 9-11 a.m. on Thursday, Aug. 9 in the Little Theater (Room 4200). Members of the Student Volunteer Program will be at this orientation to assist new students in finding classrooms, answering questions, etc. SHS volunteers will assist transfer students throughout the first week of school — introducing new students, meeting for lunch, etc.

8/9/2018.name: Orientation for Sophomores
8/9/2018.description:
For sophomores who are returning SHS students

Sophomores may choose to attend an orientation session anytime between 8-11 a.m. or noon-3 p.m. on Thursday, Aug. 9.

Orientation begins in the Patriot Lobby with students acknowledging and signing that they have received an electronic copy of the Guidebook. Students must have their paid registration receipt and school-issued iPad to receive their Student ID.
 
Those students who had their ID photo taken last spring should report to Room 2104 to pick up their pre-printed ID. Those who did not take their picture in the spring will have their picture taken in 2104. Once a student has either received their ID or taken their picture, they will be directed to the Forum to pick up their ID’s (if theirs wasn’t pre-printed), and to pick up their schedules in the upper Forum. After sophomores have obtained their schedules, they will proceed to get their yearbook photo taken in the Testing Center (Room 1200/1202), or to the Lower Sport Center to pick up their textbooks. Students will not be able to pick up schedule/textbooks until they have signed electronically, obtained their ID and have their hand stamped by a dean.

No bus service will be available during orientation for sophomores.

For sophomores who are transfer students

Transfer students will attend Transfer Student Orientation from 9-11 a.m. on Thursday, Aug. 9 in the Little Theater (Room 4200). Members of the Student Volunteer Program will be at this orientation to assist new students in finding classrooms, answering questions, etc. SHS volunteers will assist transfer students throughout the first week of school — introducing new students, meeting for lunch, etc.

8/9/2018.name: Dance Placement Reassessments
8/9/2018.description:
This reassessment is to accommodate transfer students and those adding dance to their schedule after placements or over summer. Those already registered who believe their skill set has significantly improved over summer or since their initial assessment may also attend.

Since this is the first year we are doing this placement, we would like to have an idea of our numbers. Please fill out the appropriate Google Form below if you plan to attend. If you already filled out the form when it was a "Save the Date," you do not need to resubmit your information.

Dance Placement Sign-Up

8/10/2018.name: Orientation for Freshmen
8/10/2018.description:
Freshmen orientation will take place on Friday, Aug. 10 from 8 a.m.-3:25 p.m. Freshmen will receive their schedule and school ID that day.

Students will need to bring their paid registration receipt and their school-issued iPad to orientation. The registration receipt was provided during online registration. 

Bus service will be provided for freshmen orientation. Route information will be posted here when it becomes available.

8/13/2018.name: First Day of School
8/13/2018.description: The opening day of school for 2018-19 is Monday, Aug. 13. Classes will begin at 8:30 a.m., and the school will follow the regular daily bell schedule. School will be dismissed at 3:25 p.m.

8/13/2018.location: East Commons, near parking lot C
8/13/2018.name: Choral Guild Kickoff Dinner
8/13/2018.description: All choir students and parents are invited and encouraged to attend. This is a great opportunity to meet new families and welcome back old friends. Come and learn about this year's exciting choral activities, program information, upcoming fundraisers, and our new choral spirit wear. Also, meet the SHS choral directors and the Choral Guild board members.

8/14/2018.description: All PPA members are encouraged to attend! This meeting will be located in the Multi-Purpose Room (5044), near the principal's office.

8/16/2018.name: Fall Musical Vocal Clinic
8/16/2018.description: Students interested in auditioning for the fall musical are encouraged to attend this pre-audition vocal clinic. Excerpts from selected songs will be taught. There will also be a review of callback vocal selections.

8/17/2018.name: Freshman Mixer
8/17/2018.description: All incoming freshmen are invited to the Wood Commons for this free, lock-in event, featuring a DJ and refreshments. Students must have their ID card to enter. Enter and exit through parking lot E (Sports Center entrance, enter campus off Port Clinton Road). The mixer is a "lock-in," so students must stay the entire two hours. The Freshman Mixer is sponsored by the Patriot Parent Association and the SHS Student Activities Division.

8/20/2018.name: Musical Auditions Begin
8/20/2018.description:
Auditions for the 2018-19 musical, Shrek the Musical, will be held Monday-Thursday, Aug. 20-24. Please report to the Performing Arts Center at 3:30 p.m. each day.

Sign up for an audition slot and download the audition packet from the auditions and rehearsals page.

Here is the audition schedule:

Monday, Aug. 20 - Vocal auditions
Tuesday, Aug. 21 - Dance auditions
Wednesday and Thursday, Aug. 22-23 - Callbacks

8/21/2018.description:
Tuesday and Wednesday, Aug. 21-22

3:30-7 p.m. each day

Dance Company Information and Sign-Up

8/22/2018.name: Open House Last Names A-L
8/22/2018.description:
2018 Open House Nights

Wednesday, Aug. 22 / Last Names A-L / 7-9:30 p.m.
Thursday, Aug. 30 / Last Names M-Z / 7-9:30 p.m.

Have a schedule conflict on one of the nights? No problem! Attend on the other date

Each year, Stevenson High School holds Open House evenings for parents. These evenings provide faculty and staff with the opportunity to meet parents of SHS students, inform them about the curriculum in the courses their children are taking, and showcasing many of the resources offered to students and families.

During Open House, parents will visit each of their student's classrooms and meet their child’s teachers. All parents will receive a letter from the school that includes a blank schedule for the evening, listing the times for each class period. Parents should have their students fill in his/her courses, room numbers, and teachers’ names prior to attending Open House. Parents may also choose to print their student’s schedule through Infinite Campus. Parents should bring this schedule with them.

Parents of freshmen and transfer students also will have the opportunity to hear from their counselor from 6:15-6:45 p.m. Counselors will discuss their roles and answer questions. Each student’s counselor is listed on the schedule distributed during orientation in August. The counselor also may be found through Infinite Campus. Counselor locations are listed below.
West Building     East Building  
Amy Grove  Room 2900   Griffin Dwyer   Room 7052
Mary Jones  Room 2818   Ray Tad-y  Room 7054
Sarah Kellogg  Room 2628   Patty Martin  Room 7058
Megan Kelly  Room 2630    Lisa Scanio  Room 7060
Irina Kogan  Room 2624   Carol Seeger  Room 7062
Lindsay Perkins/
Danielle Colletti		  Room 2622

   Terese Sullivan

  Room 7064
Dan Puglisi  Room 2626   Dawn Timm  Room 7056
Tim Roznowski  Room 2816    
Hector Vazquez  Room 2812    
Jorie Walton  Room 2814    
Maps of the building will be provided at all main entrances to help parents navigate the school, or their student may pick up a map prior to Open House in Rooms 2400 or 3046. Students from the Freshman Mentor Program also will be stationed throughout the two buildings to help direct parents to any location.

Parking will be available on campus but it is limited. (Parking map) A map of all parking lots and instructions can be downloaded here. Parking is also available at the Quill Corporation parking lot just south of Route 22 on Schelter Road. The school will run shuttle buses to and from the Quill parking lots throughout the evening.

The school follows a late-arrival schedule the day after each open house. Classes will begin at 10:30 a.m. Thursday, Aug. 23 and Friday, Aug. 31.

9/13/2018.name: Fall Play: Distracted
9/13/2018.description:
What's wrong with 9-year-old Jesse? He can't sit still, he curses, he raps, and you can't get him into—or out of—pajamas. His teacher thinks it's Attention Deficit Disorder. Dad says, "He's just a boy!" And Mama's on a quest for answers.

Is Jesse dysfunctional, or just different? Don't we all have ADD, to some degree? She consults a psychologist, a homeopath, a neuropsychologist, and an environmental physician. She talks to neighbors, whose kids have their own diagnoses. A psychiatrist prescribes Ritalin for Jesse, but surely a pill can't solve all of his problems.

Throughout, Jesse is an offstage voice, becoming louder and angrier, but he is in danger of fading away. And his parents' marriage is in peril. Everyone is distracted, even the actors—they're breaking character! A hilarious, provocative, and poignant look at a modern family and an epidemic dilemma: Are we so tuned into our 24/7 info-rich world that we've tuned out what really matters?

9/15/2018.name: Fall Play: Distracted (Matinee)
9/15/2018.description:
What's wrong with 9-year-old Jesse? He can't sit still, he curses, he raps, and you can't get him into—or out of—pajamas. His teacher thinks it's Attention Deficit Disorder. Dad says, "He's just a boy!" And Mama's on a quest for answers.

Is Jesse dysfunctional, or just different? Don't we all have ADD, to some degree? She consults a psychologist, a homeopath, a neuropsychologist, and an environmental physician. She talks to neighbors, whose kids have their own diagnoses. A psychiatrist prescribes Ritalin for Jesse, but surely a pill can't solve all of his problems.

Throughout, Jesse is an offstage voice, becoming louder and angrier, but he is in danger of fading away. And his parents' marriage is in peril. Everyone is distracted, even the actors—they're breaking character! A hilarious, provocative, and poignant look at a modern family and an epidemic dilemma: Are we so tuned into our 24/7 info-rich world that we've tuned out what really matters?

11/16/2018.name: Musical: Shrek the Musical
11/16/2018.description:
Based on the Oscar-winning DreamWorks film, ​Shrek The Musical is a Tony Award-winning fairy tale adventure, featuring songs from Jeanine Tesori (Thoroughly Modern Millie; Caroline, or Change) and a sidesplitting book by David Lindsay-Abaire.

RRULE:FREQ=DAILY;UNTIL=20181117T190000;INTERVAL=1 Shrek brings all the beloved characters you know from the film to life on stage and proves there's more to the story than meets the ears.

"Once upon a time, there was a little ogre named Shrek...." And thus begins the tale of an unlikely hero who finds himself on a life-changing journey alongside a wisecracking donkey and a feisty princess who resists her rescue. Throw in a short-tempered bad guy, a cookie with an attitude and over a dozen other fairy tale misfits, and you've got the kind of mess that calls for a real hero. Luckily, there's one on hand ... and his name is Shrek.

11/18/2018.name: Musical: Shrek the Musical
11/18/2018.description:

11/20/2018.name: Dance Demonstrations
11/20/2018.description:
The Fine Arts Division will host a Dance Demonstration during all class periods in the West Auditorium. Parents are invited to attend during their student’s dance class period to highlight the work being done this semester. 

Each class period will feature an informal lecture and demonstration consisting of dance phrases and solo work students have learned and created. Two dance classes will perform in each class period. Here is the schedule for the day

The West Auditorium is located near the Forum and the Point. Park in lot B or E. When entering the building, sign in at the entrance and receive a visitor sticker. Make sure to have a driver's license or form of ID when signing in. Please arrive 15 minutes before the period starts to have ample time to sign in and get a seat.

Parents who have questions should contact their student's dance teacher.

4/27/2019.name: Prom
4/27/2019.description:
The Prom will be held at the Renaissance Convention Center in Schaumburg. All those attending the Prom must ride the bus to and from the event. Students should check in at Stevenson by 5:30 p.m. The buses will leave at 5:45. Buses will load and depart from the Renaissance Convention Center at 10:15 and return to Stevenson.

• Prom is a formal event. Tuxedos and evening gowns are appropriate.
• Prom is a lock-in event and students will not be permitted to leave before the end of the dance.

For all the Prom and post-Prom details, visit www.d125.org/prom.

5/24/2019.name: Class of 2019 Graduation
5/24/2019.description:
The Class of 2019 commencement ceremony will be held at 5 p.m. Friday, May 24 at the Sears Centre Arena in Hoffman Estates.

Doors open for public seating at 3:30 p.m. There is adequate seating for all as well as adequate handicap seating for those who require special assistance.

Graduates must arrive no later than 4 p.m. and enter through the rear receiving dock doors.

Visit www.d125.org/graduation for information on tickets


Directions To The Sears Centre 
The Sears Centre Arena is located in the Prairie Stone Business Park immediately north of the Northwest Tollway and west of Illinois Route 59. 

From the East: Take I-90 west (Northwest Tollway) to the New Sutton Road (Route 59) exit and go straight. The arena will be on your right. 

From the West: Take I-90 (Northwest Tollway) to the New Sutton Road (Route 59) exit. Turn left onto New Sutton Road and go north to the next traffic light. At the light, make a left turn onto Hoffman Boulevard. The arena will be on your right.

See the Sears Centre website for additional directions and traffic information:  www.searscentre.com/arena/directions

Parking at the Sears Centre
There are 3,200 parking spots at the Sears Centre Arena. Handicapped parking is located outside the Main Entrance. We encourage you to arrive early to avoid congestion. The lots are accessible off of Prairie Stone Parkway, Hoffman Boulevard, and Pratum Avenue. Once inside, Prairie Stone signage and parking attendants will direct you to the closest lot.

Commencement Photos
Professional pictures are taken by Visual Image Photography, Inc. during the Commencement ceremony. To access photographs taken at graduation go to www.vipis.com. Choose the state and school. Enter student’s name or ID number. Orders are sent directly to the student’s home address.  For questions contact VIPIS at 877-847-0210 or www.vipis.com.

Diplomas
Diplomas will be mailed to all graduates the week of May 27, 2019.
